info.title: Barclays RepoHack 2023 API
info.description:
APIs for the dealers’ and clients’ interactions with financial market infrastructure services (Trade matching middleware, CCPs, CSDs) for the Barclays 2023 Repo Hackathon.
Please ensure you include your API key in the `x-api-key` header of your requests.

tags.name: Start Here!
tags.description:
Use these ping endpoints to test connectivity to hackathon APIs.
The `/public-ping` API does not need you to provide an API key and is useful to test your connectivity to the hackathon server.
The `/auth-ping` API requires your team's API key and is useful to test authentication.
If you are able to hit both APIs and successfully receive response back then you are ready to rock and roll and interact with the rest of the APIs during the hackathon.

tags.name: Trade Execution API
tags.description: This API enables simulation of dealers’ and clients’ interaction with the Trading Matching Middleware services.

tags.name: Trade Clearing API
tags.description: This API enables simulation of dealers’ and clients’ interaction with the central counterparty (CCP) trade clearing service.

tags.name: Trade Settlement API
tags.description: This API enables simulation of dealers’ and clients’ interactions with the central securities depository (CSD) services.

tags.name: Trade Query API
tags.description:
These APIs provide dealers and clients the query gateway to retrieve the trades workflow statuses and trade business events from the FMIs.
The `/repoTrades/tradeWorkflowStatus/` API provides workflow status of trades processed at the FMIs.
The `/repoTrades/tradeBusinessEventsQuery/` API provides trade business events processed at the FMIs.

post.description: Get the trade business events processed at the FMIs.

parameters.name: x-api-request-id
parameters.description: Unique request identifier for the request.

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team identifier provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-financial-member-id
parameters.description: Name of the party retrieving the trade(s) data. Possible values CLIENT01,CLIENT02,CLIENT03 OR DEALER01,DEALER02 OR CCP01 for cleared trades.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-simulation-date
parameters.description: Date on which the trade(s) was processed at the FMIs. The value should be specified in ISO date format(yyyy-MM-dd).

post.description:
Submit the trade request to the CSD's settlement service.

Input to this API is a contract formation business event in CDM format. For UC1, it is the business event returned by the trade matching middleware service. For UC2 it is the business events returned by the clearing service.

You can use the Rosetta Technology Portal to understand the specification of a business event.

parameters.name: x-api-request-id
parameters.description: Unique request identifier for the request.

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team identifier provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-financial-member-id
parameters.description: Name of the party submitting the trade (should match with the value specified in the input business event). Possible values are CLIENT01,CLIENT02,CLIENT03 OR DEALER01,DEALER02 OR CCP01 for cleared trades.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-simulation-date
parameters.description: Date on which the trade will be submitted for processing to the FMI.  Note that this parameter enables you to fast forward through the trade lifecycle for the purpose of the hackathon. The value must be specified in ISO date format(yyyy-MM-dd).

post.description: Submit the trade request to the matching service of the trade matching middleware.

parameters.name: x-api-request-id
parameters.description: Unique request identifier for the request.

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team identifier provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-financial-member-id
parameters.description: Name of the party submitting the trade (should match with the value specified in the input trade data). Possible values are CLIENT01,CLIENT02,CLIENT03 OR DEALER01,DEALER02.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-simulation-date
parameters.description: Date on which the trade will be submitted for processing to the FMI. Note that this parameter enables you to fast forward through the trade lifecycle for the purpose of the hackathon. The value must be specified in ISO date format(yyyy-MM-dd).

post.description:
Submit the trade request to CCP's clearing service.

Input to this API is a contract formation business event (in CDM format) received from the trade matching service.

You can use the Rosetta Technology Portal to understand the specification of a business event

parameters.name: x-api-request-id
parameters.description: Unique request identifier for the request.

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team identifier provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-financial-member-id
parameters.description: Name of the party submitting the trade (should match with the value specified in the input business event data). Possible values are CLIENT01,CLIENT02,CLIENT03 OR DEALER01,DEALER02.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-simulation-date
parameters.description: Date on which the trade will be submitted for processing to the FMI. Note that this parameter enables you to fast forward through the trade lifecycle for the purpose of the hackathon. The value must be specified in ISO date format(yyyy-MM-dd).

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team id assigned to your team.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

get.description: Get workflow statuses of the trades processed at the FMIs.

parameters.name: x-api-request-id
parameters.description: Unique request identifier for the request.

parameters.name: x-participant-id
parameters.description: Unique team identifier provided to your team.

parameters.name: x-financial-member-id
parameters.description: Name of the party retrieving the workflow statuses for its trade(s) processed at the FMIs. Possible values are CLIENT01,CLIENT02,CLIENT03 OR DEALER01,DEALER02 OR CCP01 for cleared trades.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: API authorization key provided to your team.

parameters.name: tradeId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the trade.

parameters.name: fmi
parameters.description: Name of the financial market infrastructure for which you will like to pull the trades details. Possible values are: TRADE_MATCHING_SERVICE, TRADE_CLEARING_SERVICE, TRADE_SETTLEMENT_SERVICE

error.title: Description of the HTTP Status code.

name.title: Description of the HTTP Status code.

businessEventSeq.title: Sequence of the Business Event processed for the trade at FMI.

error.title: Description of the HTTP Status code.

message.title: Error message.
message.example: Error occurred while processing your request. Please contact the Barclays hackathon platform team.

name.title: Name of the HTTP Status code.

message.title: Error message.
message.example: No workflow events found for given query criteria

effective_date.title: Date on which the trade contractually takes effect

maturity_date.title: Date on which the trade contractually terminates

repo_rate.title: Rate of interest on cash amount

collateral_id.title: Unique identifier of the underlying Security

cash_amount.title: Cash amount loaned in the beginning of the trade

termination_cash_amount.title: Cash amount settled at the end of the trade

fmi.title: Financial Market Infrastructure.Can be sent as empty or one of the value from(TRADE_MATCHING_SERVICE,TRADE_CLEARING_SERVICE,TRADE_SETTLEMENT_SERVICE).

fromDate.title: From date in ISO Date Time Format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX). If only date is passed then system will consider SOD("yyyy-MM-dd'T'00:00:00.000+00:00")

toDate.title: To date in ISO Date Time Format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX). If only date is passed then system will consider SOD("yyyy-MM-dd'T'00:00:00.000+00:00")

eventSequence.title: Sequence of the Workflow Event processed for the trade at FMI.

requestId.title: Unique Request Identifier of the trade request.
